knimeNode.name: InterPro Accessor
knimeNode.shortDescription: Accesses the InterPro web service (provided by EBI.ac.uk) with the user-specified settings. This node selects the chosen (protein) sequence column and sends each sequence to EBI for analysis.

fullDescription.intro:
Accesses the InterPro v4 web service (provided by EBI) with the user-specified settings. This node is a complete re-write of the original, now deprecated, node with greatly improved functionality.
WARNING: intellectual property may be exposed to the Internet by use of this node. Use this node only if you are satisfied with EBI's terms of service.
Quevillon E., Silventoinen V., Pillai S., Harte N., Mulder N., Apweiler R., Lopez R.
InterProScan: protein domains identifier (2005).
Nucleic Acids Res. 33 (Web Server issue): W116-W120
fullDescription.option: Required by EBI, this ensures they can contact you if there is a problem with your jobs during processing
Select the compatible input column to use for the protein sequences with InterProScan
If selected, CRC methods will be used by InterProScan. Selecting this options makes the query faster, so it is strongly recommended.
Perform family identifications using the selected algorithms (all are recommended unless you have problems with some algorithms with your data)

ports.inPort: Input protein sequences for querying via InterPro
ports.outPort: eg. transmembrane helix predictions or PTM sites
Results of family classification eg. GO terms
XML output and annotated sequences for each query protein
